title: IS JOINT SPONSOR OF IMMIGRANT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY IMMIGRANT'S DEBTS, BILLS ETC?
question: I AM A US CITIZEN BUT MAKE TOO LIL $$ TO SPONSOR MY HUBBY FROM ARGENTINA. MY SISTER WILL BE CO-SPONSOR. BUT I AM WORRIED SHE WILL BE FINANCIALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR HIM??? I CAN DO THAT :) THANKS!!
answers:
Anyone signing an I-864 or I-864A is undertaking a serious financial commitment and should understand its implications. Someone should not sign as a sponsor if they don't trust them to be able to care for themselves. Technically, the commitment is to pay back the government for any public benefits, and it should not extend to personal debts, but there have been court cases enforcing an I-864 obligation in, say, divorce decrees. If you have questions or doubts, consult with a lawyer.

Scott D. Pollock
www.lawfirm1.com
Yes, same as the main sponsor . And if the main sponsor is indigent or unable to assume any of the financial responsibilities, the the full weight is on the co-sponsor.
The government doesn't want people to come here to the US and being a "public charge"
